titleInfo.title: View No. 26. Chickamauga. Red House Crossing. Scott's Louisiana Cavalry and Robinson's Battery.

subject.topic: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)

mods.abstract: The view shows the bank of the Chickamauga at Red house crossing. The river is hidden by the forest growth which fringes it very heavily. The crossing is no longer a public highway and is reached through cultivated fields on both banks. This is the western bank. This crossing derived its name from a red house near it, which has been constructed by the Indians, and was torn down by the federals to make a bridge of at the crossing.A great deal of fighting occurred on both sides of the river at this point during the 18th, 19th and 20th September.

titleInfo.title: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.) Louisiana Committee. Photographs
Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Photographs

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
